vague_description: The hospital needs to determine the optimal number of medication patches and anti-biotic creams to produce within their resource constraints and treatment requirements.
detailed_description: A hospital prepares batches of medication patches and anti-biotic creams. Each medication patch requires \param{TimeMedicationPatches} minutes to prepare and \param{MaterialsMedicationPatches} units of materials. Each anti-biotic cream requires \param{TimeAntiBioticCreams} minutes to prepare and \param{MaterialsAntiBioticCreams} units of materials. Since anti-biotic creams are used more often, there must be at least twice as many anti-biotic creams as medication patches. Due to storage reasons, the hospital can make at most \param{MaxTotalBatches} batches of medication patches and anti-biotic creams in total. The hospital has available \param{TotalStaffTime} minutes of staff to spare and \param{TotalMaterials} units of materials. If each batch of medication patches can treat \param{PeopleTreatedMedicationPatches} people and each batch of anti-biotic cream can treat \param{PeopleTreatedAntiBioticCreams} people, how many batches of each should be made to maximize the number of people that can be treated?
target_objective: Maximize the number of people that can be treated with the batches of medication patches and anti-biotic creams
target_constraints: Number of medication patches is non-negative
Number of anti-biotic creams is non-negative
Anti-biotic creams prepared must be at least twice the number of medication patches
At most MaxTotalBatches batches in total for medication patches and anti-biotic creams
Available staff time is at most TotalStaffTime minutes
Available materials are at most TotalMaterials units
target_parameters: Time required to prepare a batch of medication patches
Materials required to prepare a batch of medication patches
Time required to prepare a batch of anti-biotic creams
Materials required to prepare a batch of anti-biotic creams
Maximum total number of batches of medication patches and anti-biotic creams due to storage
Total staff time available for preparation
Number of people treated by a batch of medication patches
Number of people treated by a batch of anti-biotic creams

pred_objective.objective: To determine the optimal number of medication patches and anti-biotic creams to produce given the resource constraints and treatment requirements of the hospital.

constraints: The total number of patches and creams produced should not exceed the available production capacity.
The production of medication patches must consume no more than the available units of a critical raw material specific to patches.
The production of anti-biotic creams should adhere to the limit of another essential raw material pertinent to creams.
A minimum quantity of medication patches must be produced to meet the hospital's treatment protocol for a specific condition.
Anti-biotic cream production should at least meet the baseline demand to ensure adequate supply for regular prescriptions.
Both the patches and creams together must stay within the budget allocated for raw materials and production costs.

pred_objective.objective: To maximize the production of medication patches and anti-biotic creams within the given resource constraints and treatment requirements.

constraints: There is a limited amount of raw materials available for the production of medication patches and anti-biotic creams.
The production time for creating medication patches and anti-biotic creams is limited.

pred_objective.objective: To maximize the number of medication patches and anti-biotic creams produced within the given resource constraints.

constraints: The total amount of available raw materials limits the combined production of medication patches and anti-biotic creams.
The total production time available constrains the maximum number of medication patches and anti-biotic creams that can be produced.

pred_objective.objective: Maximize the production efficiency and meet treatment requirements while adhering to resource constraints for medication patches and antibiotic creams.

constraints: Each medication patch requires 2 units of chemical A and 3 units of chemical B.
Each anti-biotic cream requires 1 unit of chemical A and 2 units of chemical B.
The total availability of chemical A is 100 units.
The total availability of chemical B is 150 units.
The hospital must produce at least 20 medication patches to meet treatment requirements.
The hospital must produce at least 30 anti-biotic creams to meet treatment requirements.

pred_objective.objective: The objective of the optimization problem is to determine the optimal number of medication patches and antibiotic creams to produce to meet treatment requirements and operate within resource constraints.

constraints: Each patch requires 2 units of material A and 3 units of labor, while each cream requires 1 unit of material A and 4 units of labor.
The hospital has a maximum of 100 units of material A and 180 units of labor available.
Each patch is required to provide relief to at least 3 patients, whereas each cream needs to provide relief to at least 2 patients.
The hospital needs to produce at least 10 patches and 5 creams to meet the minimum demand.

pred_objective.objective: Maximize treatment coverage while adhering to resource limitations.

constraints: The combined production of medication patches and antibiotic creams must not exceed the available manufacturing capacity of the hospital.
The total cost of producing patches and creams must not exceed the budget allocated by the hospital for these medications.
The supply of raw materials required for manufacturing both patches and creams is limited and must be distributed between the two without exceeding the available quantities.
The production must meet a minimum requirement of medication patches and antibiotic creams to ensure adequate treatment availability.
The production process must comply with regulatory standards, limiting the types and quantities of ingredients used.
The logistics capability of the hospital sets a maximum limit on how many patches and creams can be shipped to different locations within a given time frame.

pred_objective.objective: To determine the optimal production quantities of medication patches and anti-biotic creams that maximally utilize available resources while satisfying treatment demand requirements for both products.

constraints: The total quantity of medication patches must not exceed the available production capacity for patches.
The total quantity of anti-biotic creams must not exceed the available production capacity for creams.
The production of medication patches must meet a minimum treatment requirement determined by patient demand.
The production of anti-biotic creams must meet a minimum treatment requirement determined by patient demand.
The combined production of medication patches and anti-biotic creams must stay within the total available budget for production.
The ingredient allocation to both medication patches and anti-biotic creams must not exceed available supplies.
Regulatory constraints must be adhered to for the maximum allowable production limits of each type of medication.

Possibly varying minimum production quantities for patches and creams to meet treatment demand.
Maximum resource usage caps (e.g., budget constraints, material limits) need to be adhered to for overall production.
